content: If I read a message I get 3 Icons a Smiley, ArrowDown and a Star. For many is the first intention, that the arrowdown will open a window with smileys. Is it possible to change the arrow down to three dots ...?

@niels We have a related discussion about the chevron menus in the sidebar. I agree with several people here that three dots would be better here. @Cynthia Lin It might be worth pinging Rishi to see what the hold up on your original PR was. It's possible that whatever blocked it was something silly, like it could literally just be that we didn't have resources to test it.
Here the original message. @Cynthia Lin could you link the Pullrequest?
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/7764
It looks like the reason it was closed was that some folks didn't like the "hamburger" icons. I hope we reconsider.
Thr PR doesn't change the icon for "Message Actions (i)", which was my intention.
Correct, @niels. If we successfully lobby for that PR to be reconsidered, then we would probably also change the message actions menu.
Right, but we should use a consistent icon for "Actions on an object" in the app.
And changing these to hamburgers resulted in its own problems, so we're using the chevron for now.

What were the problems with the hamburgers? Alignment kind of stuff? Or did people just not like them?

By the way this is not a hill I'm willing to die on, I've just seen a lot of feedback on this lately, and I've never been crazy about the chevrons for all the reasons people mention.
actually, just one reason, to be fair, but I think it's a good reason (chevrons seem like collapse/expand)
Agree with the feedback and Steve. Hamburger is not the right choice but three dots horizontally basically means more which is what that menu is aka more options
Actually three dots vertically is what I’ve seen represent a drop down menu in other places too

Here is what Cynthia did in her PR:

pasted image

#7764

Hmm I believe the feedback in the other thread was talking about the menu in messages which is the context I was referring to but my input applies equally here. Hamburgers are generally reserved for responsive sliding menus.
Do you have another app in mind? It would be good to screenshot some other approaches.
gmail has three dots, but I can't screenshot it due to hover

I’ve never seen hamburgers used in this context whereas three dots I’ve seen more times than I can identify clearly. I believe we should try to stick with web conventions. On mobile atm can’t screenshot.
Huh, the photo attach feature on iOS mobile seems broken.
I saw the image you attached 2 messages ago. Did you do that on the web?
no, did it from mobile
oh, sorry...
the image you are seeing is from the web
I tried to use mobile to take an image of gmail and failed. Possibly user error on my part, but it seems broken.
It is very broken in my opinion as well though maybe you’re talking about a different aspect ( a bug perhaps? ). We have an open PR to edit the flow that needs to be merged sooner than later.

I can't take a screenshot from my laptop, because as soon as I go to my snipping tool, I lose the hover. I can take a photo from my phone, but I'm too lazy to connect to my email on the phone to get it to my laptop. So I tried to take a photo from the Zulip app, and that failed too. :frown:

It is very broken in my opinion as well though maybe you’re talking about a different aspect ( a bug perhaps? ). We have an open PR to edit the flow that needs to be merged sooner than later.

I am pretty confident it's broken. I'm not super mobile savvy, but I just texted a picture of deer to my mom, so I know my phone's not completely broken.
FYI If you open the console in the “Elements” panel you’ll see a little checkbox that lets you keep elements hovered
FF?
Chrome

Actually three dots vertically is what I’ve seen represent a drop down menu in other places too

@Armaan Ahluwalia I agree with you, but in this case, it's more like overflow action buttons for a menu... so I'm thinking ... (horizontal three-dots) makes the most sense

I can't take a screenshot from my laptop

what OS ?

I feel like a deer might be overkill. I still vote for 3 dots

menu, after click.
thanks @tamsky !
pasted image per-message action buttons in slack

also, note the order... left to right are (action, action, action, action, menu)...
zulip currently has (action, menu, action)

menu last is also a good thing to conserve

Awesome @tamsky though I don’t understand quite why they went for horizontal three dots there ( perhaps because their icons are quite wide horizontally ) I’m slightly partial to vertical since it also indicates it’s a drop down below typically.

Totally agree with you on order of items it’s been a long time gripe of mine ( unexpressed )

also, note the order... left to right are (action, action, action, action, menu)...
zulip currently has (action, menu, action)

menu last is also a good thing to conserve

Totally agree.
I don't have a strong opinion on vertical vs. horizontal, though.

I think it doesn't really matter to users.
I think most folks are accustomed to both vertical and horizontal 3-dot groups, usually ordered last, in a row of action icons.

looks as if slack did it as you said, because their icon buttons are 30% wider than they are tall.
@Tim Abbott There's at least one easy fix here if you agree--is there any reason we put the chevron between the smiley and the star? I can't remember a good reason for this.
It's possible that I'm somehow responsible for the order of those icons, because I know I've been near that code, but if it was me, I definitely don't defend the decision now.
And just to be clear, everybody is against :deer: for the icon? As well as :elephant:? What about :squid:?
And I guess we have to consider :hamburger: for completeness sake.
Now we're just being silly.
And for completeness, can we also allow the sender of a message to use emoji responses ?

And for completeness, can we also allow the sender of a message to use emoji responses ?

Not sure what you mean?

pasted image message menu on a message I sent
pasted image message menu on a message you sent
Unless I'm misunderstanding your question, you can emoji-respond to your own message (as I did above).
Oh, I see what you mean.
You can do it with the keyboard, but we suppress the icon for some reason, huh?
I've only been using the webapp -- so ymmv.
I used + and : to react to my own messages.
(I'm in the webapp, too, and can confirm that the icons are only there for messages not sent by me.)
It's sort of strange to react to your own message, but I don't see any compelling reason to disallow it in the UI.
I guess the only reason is space. For your own messages you have the pencil icon.
So space is a bit more valuable for messages sent by yourself.
I would argue that starring your own message might be a less frequently used option.

I would argue that starring your own message might be a less frequently used option.

Maybe, although it's not completely implausible to star your own message, either.
Especially when you say something completely brilliant.
I don't feel like the current 3 message menu icons occupy too much space... especially since they disappear when you un-hover.
In which case you both star it and :congratulations: it.
Not implausible ( but not very likely ) I don’t see a reason to hide either. There’s more than enough space. If necessary it can be hidden responsively as a last resort.
Yeah...in general, when push comes to shove, we try to avoid special-casing anything related to you being the sender.
For example, you can mention yourself. Hi, @Steve Howell, this will show in pink.
(and that does indeed show in pink for me)
Obviously the pencil icon is specific to you being the sender, since only you can edit your own messages.
I don’t show up in my own mention menu on mobile
Probably sensibly. It would be ludicrous to say hi I’m Armaan. I like deer
Yeah, we should make that more consistent between the apps. We've gone back and forth on this in the web app, but I think I like the current webapp behavior.

The reason we make self-mentions pink on the webapp is that we want newbies to be able to try mentioning themselves on #test here and see what it looks like, without spamming somebody else with a mention.
And we figure that if you're mentioning yourself, you must have some reason to do it.
I like he mobile behaviour though maybe it went a bit too far with special casing. Perhaps there is some case one can’t think of offhand.
I don't think it's clear cut either way.

One reason thinking a bit further down the road is that if we enable @mentions to become clickable it could be useful to mention yourself in certain contexts such as meetings or declarations of groups etc
I do think clicking an @mention should bring up the same popup menu as the chevron does currently in buddy list ( though you could just as well click the avatar for that menu of the sender )
On the web app you can click on mentions. Try clicking here @Armaan Ahluwalia.
Sorry I’m on mobile ( guess I misremembered web app functionality )
That's probably more good feedback for #mobile.
Will just tag @Boris Yankov on this in case there’s anything here he thinks is interesting.

The two things that came up:

  • on the webapp, you can mention yourself, and it shows pink
  • on the webapp, you can click on mention pills to get a user menu

Did I leave anything out?

For mobile no: one thing I forgot to mention is I don’t particularly see the need for the down chevron to be the clickable area in buddy list on the webapp. I feel like the entire name should bring that menu down. I’ll stop there since this thread is getting very complex now.
I encourage you to just make a list of mobile nits and send them to #mobile.
I think you covered them

We digressed a bit on this thread, but to bring it back, I think there's some consensus on a few ideas:

  • replace chevron with three dots, not hamburger
  • not totally clear whether horizontal is better than vertical
  • Google and Slack use three dots
  • #7746 is Cynthia's original PR
  • her PR would be extended beyond the sidebar if we wanted to resurrect it
  • fear the :deer:

oh, and this set of ideas:

  • star/smilely should be consistent when it's you (either hide them or show them consistently)
  • put the popup icon to the right of everything else

We digressed a bit on this thread, but to bring it back, I think there's some consensus on a few ideas:
* replace chevron with three dots, not hamburger

I'm open to trying this.

  • not totally clear whether horizontal is better than vertical

I think we'll need to take a few screenshots and decide visually, but my guess is horizontal will be better because vertical will look too small.

  • Google and Slack use three dots

I think 3 dots is fine to try.

  • #7746 is Cynthia's original PR
  • her PR would be extended beyond the sidebar if we wanted to resurrect it

star/smilely should be consistent when it's you (either hide them or show them consistently)

I don't understand what you're talking about here, but I can't think of a case where "when it's you" would be relevant here... But I guess what you mean is the edit icon that replacing the emoji reaction icon by default? I think we just thought it was extra clutter to make it 4 icons for things you sent.

put the popup icon to the right of everything else

I think there's a reason we don't do this, namely that the filled-in star shows up in messages you aren't hovering over, and as a result visually we kinda want it on the far-right edge so that it feels close to the timestamp and not completely adrift:
pasted image

I think there's a reason we don't do this, namely that the filled-in star shows up in messages you aren't hovering over, and as a result visually we kinda want it on the far-right edge so that it feels close to the timestamp and not completely adrift

FYI Tim that’s a super simple fix. Just means that you have to set the display to none for the hidden elements instead of setting their opacity to 0

I guess the real issue you probably meant is that the star would shift leftwards on hover. 2 possible solutions -

1) instead of hiding the elements completely set their opacity to be extremely grayed out so as not to distract

2) move the three dots to the right of the time stamp. That’s probably a more natural place to look for a “more” menu anyway is the right edge of an element.

"more natural place for a more menu" ~= the right edge of an element

If timestamps could move, say, next to the message sender's name,
that would allow the group of "message actions" to sit at the right edge of the element.

the filled-in star shows up in messages you aren't hovering over

perhaps instead of a filled-in star glyph per starred message,
render starred messages with a tinted background color,
and always hide all action items on non-hovered messages.

These together would take the per-message buttons from:
(Sender pencil, emoji, menu, star, timestamp)
to:
(Sender timestamp pencil, emoji, star, menu)

so that it feels close to the timestamp and not completely adrift

imho, the timestamp is what's adrift (at least in the webapp)
— moving it closer to the message sender's name would increase the context it provides

@tamsky Keep in mind the eye is searching for date as well as timestamp in the upper-right hand corner. In my experience when pitching a design change on here, its best to keep changes to the very minimal. That increases the likelihood that people will be open to them and also the feasibility of implementing the change without bugs is a lot lower.
To reiterate my proposal, I feel like the three dots could move to the right of the timestamp and all other icons come to the left of it starting with the star.
Moving the timestamp to the left doesn't make sense -- it makes it much harder to scan the time history.
I'm pretty sure the current configuration is driven by exactly what TIm says--I think we used to have other configurations, and they all had worse downsides.
Moving the actions menu to the right of the timestamp we could consider (we could also think about making it a menu you get from clicking the timestamp, which might be better)
it's already to the left, do you mean immediately to the left of the timestamp?
Oops, meant right, edited.
so pencil/smiley, star, timestamp, caret
I thought we were doing three dots?
Hmm, I suspect it'll look weird having the timestamps not justified.
What do folks think about making the actions menu be what you get from clicking the timestamp? Downside is that it's kinda subtle, but that is what e.g. GitHub does.
I don’t immediately like the idea. Prefer three dots
Clicking on a time stamp I would expect to change the time format

I think if we keep a menu, the three-dots-vs.-caret is somewhat orthogonal to the position debate.

As for making the timestamp how to launch the menu, I'm not crazy about it, and it took me a while to figure out the UI on GH.
I don't think any product does that, whereas Twitter and GitHub work as I describe.
On many OSes you click on time to change time stuff.
Yahoo Mail also works like Twitter (er, kinda, the timestamp turns into a trash can icon, but same idea).

Isn't that what Yahoo is doing?

how about the following?

  • smiley-star-3dots-timestamp for unstarred messages
  • smiley-3dots-star-timestamp for starred messages
That would solve the double-click-star problem. (I'm sort of only half joking.)
Yeah, you want the star to stay in the same place after clicking it. Feels really weird if it doesn't.

3 dots - timestamp = normal
pencil - smiley - star - 3 dots - timestamp = hover

We can also think about putting icons under timestamp since messages are always at least 2 lines high ( not my first choice though )
@Armaan Ahluwalia If a message is starred, we want to show that always.

Yeah, you want the star to stay in the same place after clicking it. Feels really weird if it doesn't.

well, it could still stay in the same place after clicking, and then slide over once the mouse moves off the message.

messages are always at least 2 lines high

You can get a 1 line high message if you send two short messages in a row.

I think we have enough space to work with here

I think we probably don't want to extend past 3 icons with our current design. The wider the icon list, the narrower the message content in our current design.
Aren't we forgetting that you currently can't react to your own messages
So essentially you're adding an icon for a missing feature
Plus three vertical dots will save some space by replacing the current down chevron
reacting to your own message is in the down chevron menu
Seems a bit counter intuitive that the position of reactions changes depending on if its your message or not
I think 3 of us were completely unaware that even existed ( if you scroll up and read the chat )

But were folks unaware of that because they wanted to add a reaction to their message, or because they've never wanted to? I think this is because it's a low-value use case that it's totally reasonable to hide.
Fair point ( which i also made earlier )
Though i can think of times in a less serious chat when you want to react to your own message ( I've seen it done on this forum itself by users )
As I mentioned earlier, I use hotkey to react ("+" and ":"). I've occasionally reacted to my own messages on purpose, but often by accident.
I think I'm pretty happy with the status quo with the smiley icon.
I'd say I'm happy with leaving as is but replacing down chevron with three dots and moving it next to timestamp either left or right
And replacing down chevron with three dots across all three columns of the app

Solved it in the meantime by customizing css with

i.fa-chevron-down:before {
    content: "\FE19";
}

Added a custom.css in the app and use stylebot to make it active in chrome.
It's a hack but solved my pain with the chevron-down....
Perhaps 22EF is the better choice
I used 22EF for the last 5 days and really like it. It a much more intuitive user experience.
